column4: What is the package management system in Ubuntu called, synaptic or aptitude?
apt
its personal preference, people liking guis seem to rate synaptic, apptidue can be used using a curses front end
have you tested with any other gnome 3 packages
sorry, any other gtk3 distros/packages
have I tested any other gtk3 packages in ubuntu 11.04?
no, tested your product against any other gtk3 rendered software, eg: fedora 15,
http://code.google.com/p/rawtherapee/issues/detail?id=794
that doesn't answer my question
if you're a developer on a project, I expect much better base analysis of problems
it doesn't answer your question, it offers more information on the subject
yes, but I asked a question not more information
it provides no more information that what you've already pasted in this channel
i offered more information of my own accord before answering your question.
assuming the theme is wrong in fedora 15, what's the issue?
I'd look at the base differences between the desktops, the core thing is gtk3

so you don't actually know what the problem is? "I'd look into gtk3" is quite obvious, I was hoping that people who would respond to my question would actually have experienced something similar and would be able to point me closer to the problem.
well seeing as you've done no debugging and given me no information to work with, it's pretty hard to give you the exact problem or a possible resolution
no debugging?
the fact that if you think "it's gtk3 is quite obvious" why have you not tested it with other gtk3 rendering projects/distros to prove/disprove this
i came here to save time installing other distros, hoping to get a response from people who've had similar gtkrc issues
don't lie - you didn't know it was a gtk issue, or you'd not be pointing out that it works in fluxbox or other such desktops
I suggest as a developer you stop expecting people to debug your package problems and start doing the basics and giving people more information to actually helpyou
this is not gtk debugging - try #gtk or do some debugging yourself for your own software
